repnme.cdata!:
Guinea-Bissau - Third Economic Governance
            Reform Grant Project : Executive Directors meeting, June 21,
            2011 - summary of discussion

abstracts.cdata!:
Republic of Guinea-Bissau in the amount
            of SDR 4 million on the terms set out in the
            President's Memorandum. Mr. Solomon wished to be
            recorded as abstaining. Directors commended the authorities
            for the recent progress made in economic stabilization,
            which helped to consolidate recent policy achievements in
            the wake of Guinea-Bissau reaching the Heavily-indebted Poor
            Country (HIPC) completion point. Directors noted the
            remaining challenges to more rapid growth and effective
            poverty reduction, including strengthening economic
            infrastructure, improving the business environment, and
            promoting activity in such sectors as agriculture that
            strongly impact income generation and poverty reduction.
            Finally, Directors acknowledged that high risks remain and
            encouraged the authorities and donors to draw from the
            lessons of the 2011 World Development Report (WDR) to focus
            on poverty reduction, access to services and effective
            judicial systems.

repnme.cdata!:
Guinea-Bissau - Third Economic Governance
            Reform Grant Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The main development objectives of the
            Third Economic Governance Reform Grant (EGRG) Program for
            Guinea-Bissau are to: (i) promote efficiency, transparency
            and accountability in the use of public resources through
            improved public financial management (PFM); and (ii) improve
            specific aspects of the investment climate, including
            streamlined procedures for business registration and
            licensing, enhanced legal and taxation frameworks to foster
            private investment and new regulation to support
            environmental sustainability in public and private
            investment projects. The operation is designed to assist the
            Government of Guinea-Bissau in completing the first steps in
            a long term process of financial and management reform that
            was initiated in 2009. Recognizing the challenges posed by a
            difficult economic and political context and a fragile
            institutional environment, the project will support the
            completion of significant reforms in key areas of public
            administration and private sector development. While modest
            in their development objectives, such improvements will be
            instrumental in enabling the government to meet the larger
            objectives of reducing poverty and achieving levels of
            economic growth comparable to those of other countries in
            the region. Guinea-Bissau has made considerable progress in
            realigning its macroeconomic policy with its long-term
            development goals by implementing a focused agenda of
            complementary reforms supported by the two previous EGRGs.
            Despite encouraging progress in recent years on the economic
            and institutional fronts, Guinea-Bissau continues to face
            extraordinary short- and medium-term development challenges
            typical of a fragile state.
